alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 07 at 9:21PM CDT until May 07 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR LIVINGSTON COUNTY... At 920 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Braceville to near Saunemin to near Cooksville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Emergency Management. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Including the following interstate... I-55 between mile markers 188 and 217. This dust channel will be near... Cullom around 930 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this dust channel include Campus, Emington, Strawn and Reddick. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
